answers.author: Maxwell Moline
answers.text:
John,
I found a number of resources that may be able to help you.
Coppell, TX has a text-a-tip program through Tip411, a software offered by CitizenObserver.
http://icma.org/en/Article/102316/Coppell_TX_Police_Department_Launches_New_Public_Safety_Alert_and_Anonymous_Tip_Software
Blackboard Connect, which is one of ICMA’s Strategic Partners, offers many softwares, including those that can host a text-a-tip program.
http://www.blackboard.com/Markets/Government/Connect-for-Government/About-Blackboard-Connect.aspx 
A few years ago, MSNBC reported on a number of cities using such programs.
http://www.nbcnews.com/id/34185801/ns/us_news-crime_and_courts/t/police-tap-text-a-tip-programs/#.UQfxNL9EF9U
The City of Evanston, IL—a city whose officials are active in the Knowledge Network—has an anonymous tip texting program.
http://www.cityofevanston.org/police/text-a-tip/#
Wilmington, NC also has such a program. 
http://www.tip708.com/text_a_tip.html
Finally, TipSoft is a program that lets people anonymously submit tips to police.
http://www.smscrimetips.com/
I hope this answer gives you a good mixture of resources. Let us know if you need more information or have more questions.
Thanks,
Max Moline
Knowledge Network Intern
ICMA

answers.author: Mitchell Stern
answers.text:
John,
I just received a quote for a program from Nixle.  If you're not familiar with Nixle, they offer an emergency mass notification system via cell phone text messaging and email.  The notification service is free to emergency service related government agencies.  We've been using them for a few years, and the residents love it.  Their "tips" software, along with mass landline phone dialing (reverse 911) is where they make their money.   They're nationally recognized as a leader in their field.
Other then Nixle, I've also reviewed Max's suggestion, TipSoft.  They've been around for awhile, and seem very reputable.
If you have any questions about Nixle, you're more than welcome to email or call me.
Good Luck 
Mitchell

author: John Hofer
text:
We are implementing a community wide (10,000 pop.) text a tip program for our Police Department. We have looked at a couple of different host options for this service and were curious what pros and cons others have found with their hosting services? . When responding please provide the name of your host. 
Thanks,
Chief Hofer
title: Text a Tip (Host)
